intro: Clavija septentrionalis, commonly known as the northern clavija, is a species of flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible or medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit, with slender stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of hair, which helps reduce water loss in its dry habitat. Clavija septentrionalis is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy environments.
